intro: Weinmannia marquesana, commonly known as the Marquesan weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Mo'orea in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
